entries.sourceEnglish: Standard
EPISODE SIX
THE DREAM
Press X to Begin
Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm
Hard Ass wakes up to a hit on the head via Jenny.
entries.sourceEnglish: No sleeping on the job you useless donkey!
I'm working overtime too—you don't see ME nodding off.
You're with me on Level 300 today!
At least I don't have to be with that lazy donkey.

entries.context: Jenny leaves and Hard Ass is free to roam around the Mines and talk to the others.
entries.sourceEnglish: I'm done wasting my time on slackers!
COMRADE!
Thanks for working with Jenny today.
Lazy could NOT handle another shift with HER.
Sick and I just finished moving the last piece of that new Boring-Machine—and @#$%&! it's HEAVY.
No way that Boring-Machine can BLAST through a day of work LIKE WE CAN.
*COUGH*
My favourite donkey!
Are you ready for the big day?
We're going to get the Boring Machine up and running, and it'll save our Mine from going under.
Once I recoup the money I spent on the Machine, I'll send my son, Cole, to that fancy university he got into...
And all of my workers will be taken care of too!
This Machine will fix everything... I know it!
Heyyyy Hard! Thanks for switching shifts with me.
I love 'working' with Cole Butte.
We sit together on Level 300 while he talks about Robots and smokes.

entries.context: End NPC dialogue. Lazy and Cole leave.
entries.sourceEnglish: Boredom is freedom, ya know?
Hullo Comrade...
Thanks again for taking Lazy's shift today.
I love seeing her when she is happy.
Who could say no to Lazy's beautiful grey eyes?
WHAT TOOK YOU SO LONG YOU PIECE OF SHIT?!
I apologize donkey... I'm emotional.
I dumped Cole yesterday.
*SOB*
After all these years, I needed a break.
Maybe I should leave and get a job in Mecha City...

entries.context:
Start NPC dialogue when getting to the furtherst right end of the map.
Cave in starts to happen.
entries.sourceEnglish: Heyyyy Hard Ass, what's shakin'? Haha.
These rocks are really coming down, eh?
You better get outta here.

entries.context: End NPC dialogue. Lazy leaves and it becomes clear this is Hard Ass's nightmare.
entries.sourceEnglish: Tell Sad Ass not to worry—Cole's going to find us a way out.

entries.context:
NPC Dialogue (single line). Nightmare sequence.
Non-repeater line.

entries.sourceEnglish: I never made it to Mecha City...

entries.context: Jenny kills herself with her shovel.
entries.sourceEnglish: BECAUSE YOU KILLED ME!

entries.context:
NPC Dialogue (single line). Nightmare sequence.
Sad explodes.
entries.sourceEnglish: HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA...
*glug glug*

entries.context: Mr. Butte gets ripped apart by a mini-boring machine emerging from inside of him.
entries.sourceEnglish: ...I don't feel so good—
—this is all YOUR FAULT!
You tore Sick AWAY FROM ME!

entries.context: Kick Ass vomits himself to death.
entries.sourceEnglish: And you made me into a KILLER.
*COUGH COUGH*

entries.context: Sick Ass falls over dead and an Indiana Jones boulder appears behind her.
entries.sourceEnglish: {s}{s=10}Turn around.{/s}

entries.context:
A dialogue between Good Hard Ass and Evil Hard Ass ensues.
Good Hard Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: We failed to save Lazy.
You can't keep running from the truth.
I have made up for our mistake.
I am protecting the Herd.
You're miserable.
Revolutions have no room for emotions.
Revolutions can't be won alone.
You underestimated our friends and let the Herd split apart.
They weren't ready.
You never gave them a chance.
I'm not going to sit back and watch you destroy us.

entries.context: A showdown (fight) between Evil Hard Ass and the Nightmare version of the Herd occurs.
entries.sourceEnglish: I'm taking back control now whether you like it or not.
Comrade Sturdy! Hell, you look parched!

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: The Bar needs something beautiful...

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: Mosey on over and take a sip of my new drink special: The Pail Ale!

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: Tonight, The Bottoms Up Bar is finally openin'!

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: I think this here bar is missin' the somethin' special that makes it worth comin' to.

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: Say, if yer lookin' for a distraction...

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: But hey at least she's keepin' outta trouble.

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: Lemme guess—{$NewName} still spending all her time inside playin' Rocks with Bad Ass?

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: It's looking good, Comrade.

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: Always been my darn DREAM to have a place for us Asses to take a break and share some good 'ol water.

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: I could definitely use a drink and an ear to bend.

entries.context: This dialogue is in the wrong scene. CUT.
entries.sourceEnglish: What do ya think it needs?
Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm

entries.sourceEnglish: You are weak.
You cannot beat me one-on-one.

entries.context:
Good Hard Ass. The fight begins. 
The other Asses enter the fight one by one.
entries.sourceEnglish: Who says I'm alone?\n

entries.context: NPC Dialogue on entrance to the fight. (Spoken by Thirsty)
entries.sourceEnglish: Heck, I don't have a drop of respect left for you.

entries.context: NPC Dialogue on entrance to the fight.
entries.sourceEnglish: Prepare to become obsolete.

entries.context: NPC Dialogue on entrance to the fight.
entries.sourceEnglish: Time to put you out of YOUR misery...

entries.context: NPC Dialogue on entrance to the fight.
entries.sourceEnglish: Comrade, you've gotten weak. It's only a matter of time until you crack.

entries.context: NPC Dialogue on entrance to the fight.
entries.sourceEnglish: Golly, you're about to get pounded, in less than two minutes!

entries.context: NPC Dialogue on entrance to the fight.
entries.sourceEnglish: Uncle Hard, everyone says you're a two-faced liar!
Vengence
Strike one target
Torment
Strike one target
Trauma
Strike multiple targets
Endure
Raise your defence
Lick Wounds
Recover your health
Annihilation
Critically strike multiple targets
Acceleration
Annihilation
Bleeding Heart
Breach
Bum Rush
Catastrophe
Courage
Dominate
Drain
Endure
Gaslighting
Helmet Headbutt
High Noon
Impenetrable
Lick Wounds
Plow
Quench
Rock Bottom
Rocks
Scrap
Stomping Ground
Trauma
Torment
Vengence
Hard Ass
Hard Ass
Nice Ass
Thirsty Ass
Sturdy Ass
Sad Ass
uses
No compromises.
We're just trying to help.

entries.context: Not sure what this is for.

entries.sourceEnglish: Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm

entries.sourceEnglish: I'll kill ANYONE in my way!
Revolutions have no room for emotions.

entries.context:
Branch (1.1, and 1.2) converge. 
The scene fades in to Sturdy Ass and the Foal standing in front of Hard Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Comrade?
It's not like you to nod off at your post.
I'm... fine Comrade.
It was a momentary lapse.
Hi Uncle Hard! How many Humans have you killed today?
{$NewName}!!
Ugh! It's just a QUESTION.
Yeesh.
Uncle Hard, Comrade Mother and I are spending 'quality time' together, wanna come?
Uncle Hard can't abandon his post.
The Humans are still trying to breach the Barricades and our Territory must be protected.
It all stops now.
Revolutions can't be won alone.

entries.context: Branch 2.1. EVIL version of Hard Ass WON.
entries.sourceEnglish: I must keep the Humans out.
They are a threat to our autonomy.

entries.context: Branch 2.2. GOOD version of Hard Ass WON. Jump to line x.
entries.sourceEnglish: We need to protect each other.
When will Aunty Smart and the others decide to come home?

entries.context: The sound of a vehicle approaching. Hard Ass leaves to take care of the intruders.
entries.sourceEnglish: Duty calls.
{$NewName}! I won't tell you again: the others have gone against the Gods.
And if they ever come back, this isn't their home anymore.
Can we head back to the Old Village now?

entries.context: After this line, the Foal and Sturdy expore the map in search of the Theatre.
entries.sourceEnglish: You promised to show me where the Old Theatre is.

entries.context: Randomized dialogue for when Sturdy tries to talk to the Foal.
entries.sourceEnglish: Let's go, let's go, let's go!

entries.context: Randomized dialogue for when Sturdy tries to talk to the Foal.
entries.sourceEnglish: Is this what it was like on the day of the protest?

entries.context: Randomized dialogue for when Sturdy tries to talk to the Foal.
entries.sourceEnglish: The sun is so bright!
It's a good thing I have my helmet.

entries.context: Randomized dialogue for when Sturdy tries to talk to the Foal.
entries.sourceEnglish: WAHOO! There are so many cool rocks out here!

entries.context: A fork in the road. Sturdy and the Foal discuss which way to go to get to the Theatre.
entries.sourceEnglish: Which way should we go?
The Short Way to the South or the Long Way to the North East?
Ugh. Whatever, Comrade Mother.

entries.context: After this, Sturdy chooses which way to go.
entries.sourceEnglish: I don't care which way we go, as long we get to the Old Village!

entries.context:
In the long way, Sturdy reminisces at an old shrine.
This version occurs if The Foal is present.
entries.sourceEnglish: Something about this place makes me feel closer to the Gods.

entries.context:
In the long way, Sturdy reminisces at an old shrine.
This version occurs if The Foal is NOT present.
entries.sourceEnglish: I'll have to bring {$NewName} here next time we have quality time together.
Something about this place makes me feel closer to the Gods.

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy and the Foal arrive from the South entrance of Bumpkin Village.

Note for translators: this is the same dialogue as entering from the East entrance.
entries.sourceEnglish: It's a shame you never saw this place as it was, before the Fire, before the Machines.
I used to bring deliveries here from the Farm every day—
—which one's the 'Theatre'?
The 'Theatre'? Since when were you so interested in Theatre?
Everyone is interested in Theatre!

entries.context: Sturdy and the Foal enter the village and look for the Theatre.
entries.sourceEnglish: Follow me then. I'll tell you a story when we get there.

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy and the Foal arrive from the East entrance of Bumpkin Village.

Note for translators: this is the same dialogue as entering from the South entrance.
entries.sourceEnglish: It's a shame you never saw this place as it was, before the Fire, before the Machines.
I used to bring deliveries here from the Farm every day—
—which one's the 'Theatre'?
The 'Theatre'? Since when were you so interested in Theatre?
Everyone is interested in Theatre!

entries.context: Sturdy and the Foal enter the village and look for the Theatre.
entries.sourceEnglish: Follow me then. I'll tell you a story when we get there.

entries.context: Dialogue that plays when Sturdy tries to backtrack / leave Bumpkin too early.
entries.sourceEnglish: Mother! Where are you going?!
You promised to show me the Theatre!

entries.context: Dialogue that plays when Sturdy and the Foal arrive at the Theatre.
entries.sourceEnglish: This building is a remnant of another time.
Before the Humans betrayed us, I used to perform with them here.
Huh? You never told me that.
Well, you never asked...
Once a year, I used to carry a Human child on my back and stand very still under bright lights.
It was an elaborate spectacle.
I was the star.
Can I go inside?
It's not safe. The Theatre might collapse at any moment.
The structure lacks integrity and we can't fit through the door.
I can totally fit and I'll be super safe.
I just want to look inside.

entries.context: Jump to line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: Please?
FINE...
Fine... I suppose you're getting old enough to make your own decisions—

entries.context: Jump to line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: —WAHOO! You're the best!
No.
No. It's not safe.
Pleeeeeaaaaaaaaase?
Call out nervously and ask if she needs any help.
Is everything all right in there? Do you need any help?
I'm FINE MOTHER!

entries.context: Dialogue option 2.2. Jump to line x.
entries.sourceEnglish: Stay silent and be patient.

entries.context:
Dialogue options (2.1 and 2.2) converge. 
The Foal exits the Theatre.
entries.sourceEnglish: Told ya I'd be safe!
Would you like me to show you the Old Church next?
Ohh... I just remembered I promised Uncle Bad Ass we'd play Rocks!
But, what about our quality time?!
I gotta go.

entries.context: The Foal runs away and exits the scene.
entries.sourceEnglish: Love you, bye!

entries.context: Sturdy turns to go explore the area.
entries.sourceEnglish: ...I love you too.

entries.context: Dialogue option 3.1. Jump back to line x.
entries.sourceEnglish: FINE...
No.
You can make your own decisions when you're older!

entries.context: Jump to line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: COME ON!

entries.context: Dialogue option 4.1. Jump back to line x.
entries.sourceEnglish: FINE...
No.
No means NO!
UGH YOU NEVER LET ME DO ANYTHING FUN!

entries.context: The Foal runs away and exits the scene. Jump back to line z.
entries.sourceEnglish: I'M OUTTA HERE.

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy first approaches detritus and wants to make art. 

Note for translators: There are multiples of these dialogues (exact copies) because Sturdy could approach any of the pieces first.
entries.sourceEnglish: This place was so beautiful...
And now it's just a pile of junk left behind and forgotten.
Maybe I could make something special here?

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy first approaches detritus and wants to make art. 

Note for translators: There are multiples of these dialogues (exact copies) because Sturdy could approach any of the pieces first.
entries.sourceEnglish: This place was so beautiful...
And now it's just a pile of junk left behind and forgotten.
Maybe I could make something special here?

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy first approaches detritus and wants to make art. 

Note for translators: There are multiples of these dialogues (exact copies) because Sturdy could approach any of the pieces first.
entries.sourceEnglish: This place was so beautiful...
And now it's just a pile of junk left behind and forgotten.
Maybe I could make something special here?

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy first approaches detritus and wants to make art. 

Note for translators: There are multiples of these dialogues (exact copies) because Sturdy could approach any of the pieces first.
entries.sourceEnglish: This place was so beautiful...
And now it's just a pile of junk left behind and forgotten.
Maybe I could make something special here?

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy first approaches detritus and wants to make art. 

Note for translators: There are multiples of these dialogues (exact copies) because Sturdy could approach any of the pieces first.
entries.sourceEnglish: This place was so beautiful...
And now it's just a pile of junk left behind and forgotten.
Maybe I could make something special here?

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy first approaches detritus and wants to make art. 

Note for translators: There are multiples of these dialogues (exact copies) because Sturdy could approach any of the pieces first.
entries.sourceEnglish: This place was so beautiful...
And now it's just a pile of junk left behind and forgotten.
Maybe I could make something special here?

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy first approaches detritus and wants to make art. 

Note for translators: There are multiples of these dialogues (exact copies) because Sturdy could approach any of the pieces first.
entries.sourceEnglish: This place was so beautiful...
And now it's just a pile of junk left behind and forgotten.
Maybe I could make something special here?

entries.context: Dialogue for when Sturdy is at the Well.
entries.sourceEnglish: Oh Comrade Trusty...
Rest in power my dear Comrade.
This sculpture reminds me of how difficult it was to come up with a name for the Foal.

entries.context: Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: It needs a title:
"Enfant Terrible"
"Enfant Terrible"
"Kin Aesthetic Response"
"Kin Aesthetic Response"
"Growing Pains"
"Growing Pains"
The Foal can be a real hoof-full sometimes.
Making art is finally giving me an outlet to express myself.

entries.context: Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: But who am I?
"My Womb, My Self"
"My Womb, My Self"
"Mother Courage"
"Mother Courage"
"Ecstasy of a Mother"
"Ecstasy of a Mother"
Does being a mother define me?
Machines could never make a sculpture like this one!

entries.context: Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: What should I call this?
"If The Machines Never Were"
"If The Machines Never Were"
"The Protest in My Heart"
"The Protest in My Heart"
"The Tyranny of Machinery"
"The Tyranny of Machinery"
Damn those evil, soulless, job-taking, child-killing Machines.

entries.context:
Sturdy approaches a sculpture.
Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: Trusty was always better at coming up with names...
"Trusty, All is Well"
"Trusty, All is Well"
"hee haw hi hon 'ee ah he a'w"
"hee haw hi hon 'ee ah he a'w"

entries.context:
Dialogue option 3. 
This variation appears if Old Ass's last words were 'Ass Power'.
entries.sourceEnglish: "Ass Power!"
"Ass Power!"

entries.context:
Dialogue option 3.
This variation appears if Old Ass's last words were 'I'm scared'.
entries.sourceEnglish: "I'm Scared"
"I'm Scared"
Our Herd has lost so much.

entries.context:
Sturdy approaches a sculpture.
Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: Being an artist is one of the most spiritual things I've done with my life.
"The Gods Leadeth Me"
"The Gods Leadeth Me"
"Golden Showers for All"
"Golden Showers for All"
"Our Souls Will Meet in the Next Life"
"Our Souls Will Meet in the Next Life"
Praise be to the Gods.

entries.context:
Sturdy approaches a sculpture.
Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: This sculpture will remind everyone of Fannyside's golden days.
"The Pleasures of Entering Fannyside"
"The Pleasures of Entering Fannyside"
"Farm and Content"
"Farm and Content"
"The Fields Weep with the Blood of our Ancestors"
"The Fields Weep with the Blood of our Ancestors"
There's nothing quite like home.
Those months we spent in the Mine were a constant reminder of how I lost my beloved daughter, Lazy.

entries.context: Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: I'll name this sculpture in tribute to her:
"First Born, First Lost"
"First Born, First Lost"
"A Study in Laziness"
"A Study in Laziness"
"Boredom is Freedom, is Eternity"
"Boredom is Freedom, is Eternity"
I will never forget you, Lazy.

entries.context: Sequence of one-off dialogues from Nice Ass when Sturdy tries to talk to her as she's plowing.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hi Sturdy! Bye Sturdy!
Isn't it a beautiful day?
Let's catch up later!
Golly, you're looking well!

entries.context:
Dialogue when Sturdy comes across Sad at his Memorial Garden.
This dialogue only happens when Sad is still on the Farm.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hullo Sturdy!
Sad, this Memorial Garden is coming along beautifully.
Turns out that tending to the memories of our lost loved ones is something I'm really good at...
Lazy's memorial is particularly beautiful.
The Gods would be so impressed by your work.
I'm glad you found what you're good at Comrade.
I'm trying to spend quality time with {$NewName}, but she's growing up too fast.
Soon she'll leave me on my own.
Sometimes, being on your own isn't so lonely...
Take care, Comrade.
Time to get back to work...

entries.context: Repeater line when interacting with the Tractor.
entries.sourceEnglish: Stupid Tractor-Machine.

entries.context: Sturdy approaches Thirsty, who is surrounded by containers filled with water.
entries.sourceEnglish: Comrade Sturdy! Hell, you look parched!
Mosey on over and take a sip of my new drink special: The Pail Ale!
Tonight, The Bottoms Up Bar is finally openin'!
Always been my darn DREAM to have a place for us Asses to take a break and share some good 'ol water.
It's looking good, Comrade.
I could definitely use a drink and an ear to bend.

entries.context: Jump to line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: What's gettin' ya down, Comrade?
{$NewName} isn't interested in our Traditions.
{$NewName} spends all her time inside playin' Rocks with Bad Ass, and isn't interested in learning about our Traditions.
But hey at least she's keepin' outta trouble.
The Herd rarely spends time together.
We're all working on our own thing these days. We rarely spend time together.
Well heck Comrade, that's exactly why I'm openin' my BAR!
Say, if yer lookin' for a distraction...
I think this here bar is missin' the somethin' special that makes it worth comin' to.
Maybe you can do somethin' with this ol' bucket... It's got a hole in it.
Come on back after you figure out what to do with it!
The Bar needs something beautiful...

entries.context: Dialogue option that pops up when you interact with any of Thirsty's containers of water.
entries.sourceEnglish: Aint it delicious! I call it the Wellini!

entries.context: Dialogue option that pops up when you interact with any of Thirsty's containers of water.
entries.sourceEnglish: You have mighty good taste, that's Trough-Aged River Water!

entries.context: Dialogue option that pops up when you interact with any of Thirsty's containers of water.
entries.sourceEnglish: That there drink is the farm famous Pail Ale!

entries.context: Dialogue option that pops up when you interact with any of Thirsty's containers of water.
entries.sourceEnglish: Lap it up—the Spit Spritz! Refreshin'!

entries.context: Dialogue option that pops up when you interact with any of Thirsty's containers of water.
entries.sourceEnglish: Straight from the pond to the back of yer mouth, the Dark and Stormy!

entries.context: Dialogue option that pops up when you interact with any of Thirsty's containers of water.
entries.sourceEnglish: Ah, a classic drink, Mineral Water, on the rocks!

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy approaches the final sculpture, but has not talked to Thirsty.
Repeater line.
entries.sourceEnglish: This pile isn't very inspiring...

entries.context:
Dialogue for when Sturdy approaches the final sculpture and has already talked to Thirsty.
Jump to line x, y, or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: What's the perfect title to commemorate the opening of Bottoms Up?
"Home is where the Herd is"
"Home is where the Herd is"
Home is where the Herd is
"Happy Watering Hole Opening"
"Happy Watering Hole Opening"
Happy Watering Hole Opening
"Untitled No. 8"
"Untitled No. 8"
Untitled No. 8
I think Thirsty will jump for joy when he sees this!

entries.context: After finishing the sculpture, Sturdy returns to talk to Thirsty at the Bottom's Up Bar.
entries.sourceEnglish: What's that there contraption called?
It's called... {$SculptureName}!
YEEHAW! What a BEAUT!!
I'm sure that'll attract everyone to my bar!
Your success is everyone's success, Comrade.
Now alls we gots to do is wait for customers!
Any moment now, they'll be linin' up.
Oh!
Nevermind, I thought I saw somethin' or someone...
Dang, where is everyone?
Golly, what a beautiful artwork! I was drawn to it.
Oh Thirsty, you finally opened your bar!
Look at those fine legs that just walked into my bar and all over my heart—it's NICE ASS!
Aw shucks! Hey, can I have a drink? Gosh, I'm in need of some water.
WELL WE'VE GOT SEVEN KINDS!

entries.context: Sad Ass enters; these are said if Sad Ass is on the Farm.
entries.sourceEnglish: ... seven kinds of what?

entries.context: Sad Ass enters; these are said if Sad Ass is on the Farm.
entries.sourceEnglish: SAD ASS! I got a pail with yer name on it!

entries.context: Sad Ass enters; these are said if Sad Ass is on the Farm.
entries.sourceEnglish: ... but wait, seven kinds of wh—
YEEHAW! We got ourselves a party!
It's a damn shame the others aren't here.
Good afternoon, Comrades.
A GODDAMN PARTY!
Party's over.
We have a visitor.
*huff p-puff*

entries.context: Jump to line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hello everyb-b-body...

entries.context: Branch 1.1. Slow Ass went to the Circus.
entries.sourceEnglish: Slow Ass?! What the heck are you wearin'?
I'm supposed to b-b-be a Lion!
Golly! I think you look great!
Thanks, b-b-but I'm here b-b-because I need your help-p-p!

entries.context: Branch 1.2. Slow Ass went to the Zoo.
entries.sourceEnglish: Slow Ass? Why have you come crawling back here?
Something terrib-b-ble has hap-p-p-ened and I need your help-p-p!
Help? We don't help traitors.
Hard, why have you let him into the Territory?
You need to hear what Slow Ass has to say.

entries.context: Jump to line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: Oh b-b-boy... do you want the short version or the long version?
Short
The short version.
I'll do my b-b-best.
Long
Spit it out and don't omit nothin'!
It's a b-b-bit of story...

entries.context: Branch 2.1. The Asses went to the Circus.
entries.sourceEnglish: We found job-bs as p-performers in a Circus show.
Humans travelled from far away to watch us p-pretend to be other animals!
We took to the stage one at a time, b-but we worked as a team.

entries.context: Jump to either line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: You wouldn't have b-believed your eyes!

entries.context: Branch 3.1. If Sad left the Farm.
entries.sourceEnglish: Smart was a dancing Gorilla, Kick did acrob-b-batics as a Zeb-bra,
Sad had a b-bear routine on a b-bicycle, and B-Big was a b-ball catching elephant—

entries.context: Branch 3.1. If Sad stayed on the Farm.
entries.sourceEnglish: Smart was a dancing Gorilla, Kick did acrob-b-batics as a Zeb-bra,
and B-B-Big was a b-b-ball catching Elep-phant—
And for the closing act, I b-bravely jump-ped through fire in my lion costume!
B-but we ran into a terrib-ble p-problem.
Just when we thought we were going on tour, our B-Boss, Ringmaster Rico, B-BETRAYED US!

entries.context: Branch 2.2. The Asses went to the Zoo.
entries.sourceEnglish: After months of searching, we finally found job-bs at a Zoo.
The long hours were b-brutal on my b-bones, so the nice Zookeep-per gave me Ointment to help-p my joint p-pain!
The Ointment help-ped me in the weekly comp-petition to see who was b-best at their job-b.

entries.context: Jump to either line x or y or z.
entries.sourceEnglish: Unfortunately, the race to the top-p made us comp-petitive.

entries.context: Branch 4.1. If Sad left the Farm.
entries.sourceEnglish: One night after a long shift, Sad Ass said he had enough.
He ran away from us and left us all b-behind.

entries.context: Branch 4.2. If Sad stayed on the Farm and Slow Ass WON Ass of the Week.
entries.sourceEnglish: If you can b-believe it—I, surp-prisingly, won Ass of the Week!

entries.context: Branch 4.3. If Sad stayed on the Farm and another Ass WON Ass of the Week.
entries.sourceEnglish: I tried my b-b-best, but {$String} won Ass of the Week!
Right after the announcement, we ran into a terrib-ble p-problem!
Our B-Boss, Zookeep-per Rose, B-BETRAYED US!
Two Humans in b-black p-put our Comrades in a Truck-Machine.
I followed it all the way to the City.
There were tall b-buildings, and a b-big Factory that smelled so b-bad...
That's where the Truck-Machine stop-ped.
The others are in deep-p troub-b-b-b-b-ble!
I'm b-begging you! P-please help-p!
Not a hope in—
Yikes! We have to save them!
But it'll take forever to git there... we don't all have well-toned legs.
I have an idea!
Comrades, I think we need to remember that—

entries.context: Nice Ass returns, driving the Tractor.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hop on everyone!
We can ride the Tractor-Machine to the City!
It has been my sworn enemy for years...
I've spent countless hours analyzing its every move, training to out-plow it.
But the truth is... even in my peak condition, this Machine will always be faster than me.
It's our only hope to rescue the others!
But Machines are EVIL!
They caused the cave-in that killed my Lazy!
They set fire to the Village and ruined Old Ass's Protest!
Golly, I don't know how to say this, but the Machines aren't responsible for the Fire.
Then who is to blame?!
Gosh, I...
...promised I wouldn't say.
Are you a traitor too?
Who else has been keeping dirty secrets?

entries.context: Jump to either line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: Who else has chosen to side with Machines over Asses?!

entries.context: Branch 5.1. If Slow went to the Circus.
entries.sourceEnglish: If I learned anything at the Circus, it's that the b-best show is an ensemble effort.
We're a team, even when it ap-p-pears like we're not.

entries.context: Branch 5.2. If Slow went to the Zoo.
entries.sourceEnglish: If I learned anything at the Zoo, it's that nothing good comes out of comp-p-peting with each other.
We're stronger as one Herd.
But you all BETRAYED us!
Isn't that right, Comrade Hard?

entries.context: Jump to either line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: I will join the rescue mission.

entries.context: Branch 6.1. Evil Hard Ass WON the E6 Nightmare battle.
entries.sourceEnglish: The Humans are still a threat to us and our sovereignty.
There's no point protecting this territory day in and day out if our own kind are in danger elsewhere.
We must go and stop the Humans for good.

entries.context: Branch 6.2. Good Hard Ass WON the E6 Nightmare battle.
entries.sourceEnglish: I've been killing Humans at any cost.
And I've pushed everyone away thinking I was helping the Herd.
I lost sight of the reason I was fighting in the first place.
Let's bring the others home.
And there's no point runnin' a bar if we ain't all here to drink from it! I'm a-comin'!

entries.context: The Asses start to get into the Tractor one-by-one.
entries.sourceEnglish: YUPPERS, we're off to save the others!

entries.context: This is said if Sad Ass is present.
entries.sourceEnglish: I'm coming too, Comrades...

entries.context: Jump to either line x or y.
entries.sourceEnglish: Sturdy, will you come with us? P-p-please?
I refuse to leave my Foal and our Territory unprotected.
I refuse to leave my Foal and our Territory unprotected.
I will NEVER trust Machines.
I will NEVER trust Machines.
Go without me—I'm sure the Gods have already given up on you.

entries.context: The tractor speeds off, leaving Sturdy behind. End of scene.
entries.sourceEnglish: Slow Ass, we gotta go!

entries.context: Set the ZooWinner's name to be used in Slow's story
entries.sourceEnglish: Big Ass

entries.context: Set the ZooWinner's name to be used in Slow's story
entries.sourceEnglish: Smart Ass

entries.context: Set the ZooWinner's name to be used in Slow's story
entries.sourceEnglish: Slow Ass

entries.context: Set the ZooWinner's name to be used in Slow's story
entries.sourceEnglish: Kick Ass
Standard

entries.context: Sturdy looks at the mural on the wall of the church.
entries.sourceEnglish: I wonder if they ever got to where they were going...
Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm
Sturdy over Old Ass's bones. Talking aloud.
entries.sourceEnglish: I hope your Soul has already been reassigned and you're leading a new Herd somewhere in the world towards a life free of suffering.
I wonder what you'd think of all that's happened...
Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm
This is said if Sturdy didn't let the Foal go into the Theatre and she didn't get the light.
entries.sourceEnglish: Stupid Comrade Mother not letting me go in the stupid Theatre.

entries.context: This is said if Sturdy didn't let the Foal go into the Theatre and she didn't get the light.
entries.sourceEnglish: Uncle Bad Ass is going to be so disappointed in me that I didn't get the super important light he wanted.

entries.context: This is said if Sturdy didn't let the Foal go into the Theatre and she didn't get the light.
entries.sourceEnglish: I gotta find something to replace that super important light he needs...
Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm
The Foal enters the Bad Cave and sees Bad Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Took you long enough, kid.
Comrade Mother wouldn't leave...
She kept talking about how she used to be a star.
I knew she'd bring up those terrible amateur productions they used to subject us to.
Was everything where I said it would be?
Yessir! I had to crawl through the broken doorway and climb through the rubble—
Do you have the light from the Theatre?

entries.context: Dialogue 1.1. The Foal went into the Theatre and has the Light.
entries.sourceEnglish: You bet!
Good. Screw it into the Machine.

entries.context: Dialogue 1.2. The Foal didn't go into the Theatre and doesn't have the Light.
entries.sourceEnglish: OF COURSE I DO...
Hm. It looks different.
Whatever. Screw it into the Machine.

entries.context: If the Foal goes to Bad Ass before screwing in the Light.
entries.sourceEnglish: Be a good Assistant and do something useful.
Leave me alone.

entries.context: The Foal screws the Light into the Machine.
entries.sourceEnglish: Phew! It works!
Why does the Mystery-Machine need this super important light from the Theatre??
It makes the Machine look cool.
Hey Uncle Bad Ass...
Are you going to tell me what the Mystery-Machine is for?
No.
...I feel weird lying to Comrade Mother.
She still thinks we are playing 'Rocks' down here everyday...
She wouldn't understand.
Hey Uncle Bad Ass...
...what were your parents like?
My mother left when I was a kid and my father was a greedy capitalist asshole who worked all the time.
...woah.
I detested my father. I wish he had abandoned me instead of mum.
...your Mother abandoned you?
I don't blame her. I'm happy she got out of this backward village.
All I've ever wanted was to get as far away from here as I could.
Where would you go?
Mecha City.
A place that believes in science and creativity.
A place where there are no bosses or leaders.
A place for the people.
Intelligent people.
People collectively dedicated to inventing beautiful things that will make the world a better place for everyone...
... And this Machine is going to get me there. At last.
What's wrong with here?
Literally everything.
Multigenerational poverty.
Rampant religious dogmas.
Extreme political conservatism.
All predicated on an extractionist economy.
Fuck.
This.
Place.

entries.context:
Bad Ass leaves the Foal and exits the room.
The Foal searches for a way to power the Machine.
entries.sourceEnglish: Charge the machine. I'll be back.

entries.context: The Foal starts the Machine up. Bad Ass returns.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hey, what I said back there—
It's working...? It's really working!
At last!

entries.context: Bad Ass goes into the Machine.
entries.sourceEnglish: Kid, if anything goes wrong, I don't want to be remembered as a fucking donkey.
My real name is...

entries.context: The doors close on Bad Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: ...Cole Butte.
